title: Bethlehem
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Charles J. Rosenbloom
provenance_text:
Mordecai Ardon [1896-1992], Jerusalem [1]; Passedoit Gallery, New York, NY [2]; Charles Rosenbloom [1898-1973], Pittsburgh, PA (Lugt Suppl. 633b), November 1952 until December 1952 [3]; gift of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Rosenbloom to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1952. 

Notes:
[1]. The artist was born Max Bronstein; he changed his name to Mordecai Ardon in 1936. Correspondence in the museum archives about this painting gives the artist's name as Mordecai Ardon-Bronstein. 
[2]. The painting was no. 7 in "The 1952 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Paintings" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1952.
[3]. Mr. Rosenbloom purchased the painting for Carnegie Institute from the International exhibition for $900 (check to Passedoit Gallery forwarded on November 14, 1952; receipt of payment acknowledged on November 17, 1952.) The painting was accessioned on December 11, 1952 (see relevant correspondence in curatorial file.)
